context_bundle.summary: Task partitioning methodology: breaking large tasks into context-budget blocks with clear completion criteria and checkpoint-resume capability.

onboarding.quick_start: 1. Estimate total work. 2. Define blocks (20-30% context each). 3. Number them. 4. Execute one block. 5. Checkpoint. 6. Continue or compact if needed.
common_patterns: ESTIMATE FIRST: Before starting, estimate total scope and context cost
BLOCK DEFINITION: Define clear blocks with measurable completion criteria
BLOCK SIZE RULE: Each block should complete within 20-30% context budget
NUMBERED BLOCKS: 'Block 1 of 5: Doors A50-A52 extension' - explicit tracking
COMPLETION MARKER: Each block ends with bootstrap update AND spoken summary
DEPENDENCY ORDER: If blocks depend on each other, order matters - plan for it
INDEPENDENT BLOCKS: Where possible, make blocks independent so order doesn't matter
RESUME PROTOCOL: Bootstrap contains block number, what's done, what's next
SCOPE CREEP: If block grows during execution, STOP, re-partition, don't absorb
PARTIAL BLOCK: If context nears limit mid-block, gracefully stop, note progress, resume later
known_errors: Underestimating block size - tool responses are heavy
Not defining completion criteria = unclear when to checkpoint
Skipping partition planning for 'quick' tasks that aren't quick
Forgetting to number blocks = confusion on resume
